hackathon-judges.judge-role: CTA, DST, Heart and Home Women's Shelter

hackathon-eligibility: You must be a current Undergraduate or Graduate college student. You must be able to attend 100% of the hackathon as well as stay for the awards ceremony.
hackathon-requirements: Participants are asked to create applications which will help either the low class and homeless. We do have an open cateogry where people will be able to create any kind of program. A submission will include details on your hack, a few sentences will do, as well as a website (if you have one).
hackathon-rules:
- 
- You must be signed up before the start period of Hack for the Homeless.
- Maximum team member size of 4 people.
- All code must be written during the hacking session of Hack for the Homeless.
- No mockups or wireframes can be presented as an application.
- All judging decisions are final.
Comply with all instructions from Hack for the Homeless organizers.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Santa Clara University, 500 El Camino Real, Santa Clara, CA 95050, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is this something that the homeless would use and benefit from? If so, how much?
How simple would it be for a homeless person to actually figure out how to use it?
How hard did you have to work to make this project work?
How nice does it look? How well does it work?

hackathon-location-address: Santa Clara University, 500 El Camino Real, Santa Clara, CA 95050, USA
